intro: Froelichia floridana, commonly known as the Florida froelichia, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the southeastern United States, particularly in Florida. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom during the late spring and early summer months. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, Froelichia floridana is considered a species of conservation concern.
